exercises.name: Sky Gazing (Semdzin)
exercises.primaryBenefit: Cultivates natural awareness, reduces stress-eating triggers
instructions: Sit comfortably outdoors or near a window with a view of the sky
Keep eyes open, gaze softly into the open sky without focusing on any object
Don't follow thoughts or try to stop them—let them dissolve naturally like clouds
Rest in the spacious quality of awareness itself
If distracted, gently return to the open gaze
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Regulates cortisol, enhances interoceptive awareness, calms sympathetic nervous system

exercises.name: Rigpa Recognition
exercises.primaryBenefit: Distinguishes physical hunger from emotional cravings
instructions: Sit quietly and close your eyes
Notice that you are aware—turn awareness back on itself
Don't look for an object of awareness, rest as the awareness itself
When thoughts arise, recognize they appear within awareness but aren't separate from it
Rest in this non-dual recognition for the full duration
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Activates prefrontal cortex, strengthens impulse control, improves hunger hormone sensitivity

exercises.name: Embodied Presence (Zernga-based)
exercises.primaryBenefit: Enhances mind-muscle connection and recovery awareness
instructions: Lie down or sit comfortably after physical activity
Bring attention to each muscle group, starting from feet upward
Don't visualize or manipulate—simply recognize the raw sensation
Notice tension, warmth, pulsation without labeling as good or bad
Rest in the direct knowing of bodily sensations as they are
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Improves proprioception, accelerates muscle recovery, enhances neuroplasticity

exercises.name: Natural Breath Awareness
exercises.primaryBenefit: Activates parasympathetic nervous system, improves metabolic efficiency
instructions: Sit comfortably with natural posture
Don't control the breath—let it breathe itself
Notice the space between breaths, the gap where nothing is happening
Rest attention in that spacious gap without forcing
Allow breath rhythm to settle naturally
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Optimizes oxygen efficiency, reduces stress hormones, balances autonomic nervous system

exercises.name: Cutting Through (Trekchö)
exercises.primaryBenefit: Dissolves habitual patterns including emotional eating
instructions: Sit in complete stillness, eyes open or closed
When a thought arises, recognize its empty nature immediately
Don't follow, suppress, or engage—let it self-liberate on arising
Rest in the natural state between thoughts
Maintain this recognition without effort or strain
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Rewires habit loops in basal ganglia, reduces amygdala reactivity, strengthens executive function

exercises.name: Pre-Meal Awareness Practice
exercises.primaryBenefit: Distinguishes true hunger from habit or emotion
instructions: Before eating, pause and sit for 3 minutes
Scan your body: Where do you feel hunger? Is it in the stomach or mind?
Notice any emotional states without judgment
Ask: 'Am I physically hungry or seeking comfort?'
Proceed with your meal from this clarity
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Improves leptin sensitivity, activates satiety signals, reduces impulsive eating

exercises.name: Muscle Recovery Visualization
exercises.primaryBenefit: Accelerates muscle protein synthesis and recovery
instructions: Lie down in a comfortable position
Visualize the muscles you trained as glowing with warmth and energy
Imagine nutrients flowing to those areas, repairing and strengthening fibers
See the muscles growing stronger and more defined
Rest in this visualization without forcing, let it be natural and easeful
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Enhances mind-muscle neural pathways, may increase IGF-1 signaling, improves recovery quality

exercises.name: Mindful Movement Practice
exercises.primaryBenefit: Combines gentle cardio with awareness training
instructions: Walk at a natural pace outdoors or indoors
Feel each footstep fully—heel, arch, toe
Let eyes rest softly on the path ahead without staring
When mind wanders, gently return to the sensation of walking
Don't make it a task—walk as if you're already arrived
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Increases NEAT (non-exercise activity thermogenesis), improves insulin sensitivity, reduces cortisol

exercises.name: Sound as Gateway to Awareness
instructions: Sit quietly in a space with ambient sounds
Listen to sounds without naming them or tracking their source
Notice how sounds arise, exist briefly, and dissolve
Recognize that awareness of sound is more fundamental than the sound itself
Rest in the hearing awareness, not in the sounds heard
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Reduces default mode network activity, quiets mental chatter, lowers stress hormones

exercises.name: Subtle Energy Awareness
instructions: Sit with spine naturally erect
Breathe naturally and notice any sensations of energy, warmth, or tingling
Don't force or visualize—simply recognize what's already present
Notice energy concentrating in certain areas (often belly, chest, hands)
Allow this energy to circulate naturally without directing it
exercises.physiologicalEffects: May enhance mitochondrial function, improves interoception, primes nervous system for activity

exercises.name: Emotion as Energy Practice
exercises.primaryBenefit: Transforms emotional eating triggers at their root
instructions: When you notice a strong emotion arising (especially before eating)
Don't suppress or express it—look directly at the emotion itself
Where is it in your body? What is its texture, temperature, movement?
Recognize that the emotion is energy, not a solid thing requiring action
Rest in this recognition until the energy naturally dissolves
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Interrupts stress-eating circuit, regulates limbic system, improves emotional regulation

exercises.name: Dream Yoga Foundation
exercises.primaryBenefit: Optimizes sleep quality for recovery and hormone regulation
instructions: Lie in bed in your sleeping position
Visualize a soft light at your throat center
With each breath, let tension dissolve from head to toe
Hold the intention: 'I will recognize the dream-like nature of experience'
Let go of all effort and drift into sleep naturally
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Enhances slow-wave sleep, optimizes growth hormone release, improves sleep architecture

exercises.name: Urge Surfing Practice
instructions: When a craving arises, stop and sit immediately
Don't fight the craving or give in—observe it as a wave
Notice where you feel it in your body (stomach, mouth, chest?)
Watch it peak and notice it naturally subsiding
Recognize: cravings always pass, even without action
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Strengthens prefrontal inhibitory control, reduces dopaminergic craving intensity, improves impulse regulation

exercises.name: Solar Energy Integration
exercises.primaryBenefit: Regulates circadian rhythm and optimizes metabolism
instructions: Go outside within 30 minutes of waking
Face the sun (eyes open but not staring directly at it)
Stand or sit naturally, breathing normally
Feel sunlight on your face and body
Rest in the experience of warmth and light for 5 minutes
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Optimizes cortisol awakening response, suppresses ghrelin, entrains circadian rhythm, increases vitamin D

exercises.name: Digestive Rest Awareness
instructions: After eating, sit quietly for 10 minutes before moving
Place attention gently on your belly area
Notice sensations of fullness, warmth, movement
Don't judge the sensations—simply be present with digestion
This helps recognize true satiety versus habit-driven continued eating
exercises.physiologicalEffects: Enhances vagal tone, improves nutrient absorption, allows leptin signals to reach brain
